articles.author: Emma Kemp
articles.title: Defending champion Osaka out but not down after Australian Open exit - The Guardian
articles.description: Naomi Osaka reflected on her changing attitude to defeat after the American Amanda Anisimova beat her in the Australian Open third round
articles.content:
Australian Open 2022
  • Osaka defeated 4-6, 6-3, 7-6 (5) by Amanda Anisimova
  • Japanese player had two match points in final set
Fri 21 Jan 2022 06.13 EST In months and years go… [+5483 chars]

articles.title: Mining titan's bet on fertiliser jackpot under the North York Moors hits trouble - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Thousands of shareholders lost money when Anglo-American took over Sirius Minerals and its ambitious Woodsmith project
articles.content: Led by chief executive and founder Chris Fraser, it got off to a good start. The ex-banker, born in Somerset before growing up in Australia, struck up deals with landowners, won over planning authori… [+3200 chars]

articles.author: AFP
articles.title: Defending champion Osaka knocked out of Australian Open - Times of India
articles.description: Tennis News: Defending champion Naomi Osaka was stunned Friday by unseeded American Amanda Anisimova in the Australian Open third round. The Japanese superstar won
articles.content:
Giant slayer @AnisimovaAmanda knocks out defending champion Naomi Osaka 4-6 6-3 7-6[5] to advance to the fou https://t.co/BuE7eNuFbH

articles.title: Meat Loaf, singer of I'd Do Anything For Love (But I Won't Do That), dies aged 74 - CNA
articles.description: The American singer and actor, otherwise known as Michael Lee Aday, had a career spanning six decades, and sold more than 100 million albums worldwide.
articles.content: Meat Loaf, the singer best known for the Bat Out Of Hell album and the hit song Id Do Anything For Love (But I Wont Do That), has died at the age of 74, a statement on his official Facebook page said… [+5081 chars]
